intro: Porlieria angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf porlieria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Porlieria angustifolia typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands.
